qas.question: What is the most frequent use of cotton?
To what date has cotton been dated?
Where in India has cotton been found from prehistoric times?
In what Central American country has cotton use been found from early times?
What machinery has lead to the  easily made and widespread use of cotton?
What is the most frequent use of cloth?
To what date has the cotton gin been dated?
Where in India has the cotton gin been found from prehistoric times?
In what Central American country has cotton gin use been found from early times?
What textile has lead to the easily and widespread use of cotton?

context: The fiber is most often spun into yarn or thread and used to make a soft, breathable textile. The use of cotton for <a0_0><b5_0>fabric<b5_0/><a0_0/> is known to date to prehistoric times; fragments of cotton fabric dated from <a1_0><b6_0>5000 BC<b6_0/><a1_0/> have been excavated in <a3_0><b8_0>Mexico<b8_0/><a3_0/> and the <a2_0><b7_0>Indus Valley<b7_0/><a2_0/> Civilization in Ancient India (modern-day Pakistan and some parts of India). Although cultivated since antiquity, it was the invention of the <a4_0><b9_0>cotton gin<b9_0/><a4_0/> that lowered the cost of production that led to its widespread use, and it is the most widely used natural fiber cloth in clothing today.
